subject: Investing
title: Short Selling Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply Short Selling Explained.

hook.text: Most investors buy low and sell high. Short sellers reverse it: sell high first, buy low later.

buildup.text: To short, you borrow shares, sell them immediately, and hope to buy them back cheaper to return.

discovery.text: If the stock drops from $100 to $60, you pocket $40 per share. Short sellers profit when companies fail.

twist.text: If the stock rises instead, your losses are unlimited. A stock can go to infinity. Your loss has no ceiling.

climax.text: GameStop short sellers lost over $6 billion in January 2021 when retail investors squeezed the stock to $483.

punchline.text: Shorting bets against a company. The risk is that optimism has no upper limit.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of short selling?
options: You must hold the stock forever
You can never close the position
